bio:treatment.description: Plants less than 2.5 mm. Leaves broadly linear to lanceolate, 0.8–2.5 × 0.15–0.4 mm; margins serrulate to strongly serrate distal to the proximal third; apex slenderly acuminate, papillose; costa not always apparent at the base, often filling the acumen, percurrent; areolation compact distally; median laminal cells smooth or slightly papillose; distal laminal cells somewhat papillose. Capsule with very few stomates, mostly near the base. Spores spherical or reniform, 43–107 × 35–75 µm, orange-brown.

Ont., Que., Sask.; Conn., Del., D.C., Fla., Ga., Ill., Ind., Iowa, Kan., Ky., La., Md., Mich., Minn., Miss., Mo., Neb., N.H., N.J., N.Y., N.C., Ohio, Oreg., Pa., Tenn., Tex., Va., W.Va., Wis.; Europe (Germany); e Asia (Japan); Pacific Islands (New Zealand).
